basics.name: Aaron Mayzes
basics.label: Systems and Data Analyst
basics.summary: A brief description of yourself as a candidate that appears in some résumé themes. You may use **Markdown** and/or HTML formatting here including [links](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random) or stick to plain text.

work.summary: Boeing Global Services is the parent organization of Jeppesen, A Boeing Company.

work.position: Business Analyst Team Lead, Process Operations
highlights: ETL Developer - Using both Informatica Cloud Services and Python scripts, build new mappings for several additional data sources including ServiceNow and JIRA.

Sprint Planning - Lead team of five in mapping our value streams, developing and implementing a tracking process for backlog and work-in-progress, and prioritizing work, guided by SAFe principles. Additionally, reported progress to senior leadership during manager's leave
Team Development - Focused on transferring skills to my team of five, primarily SQL queries and pricing processes.

Master Data Management - Serve as SME on topic of Customer Information. Help establish policies, procedures, and standards to improve quality of data across CLM, CRM, and ERP systems. Evaluated tools including Talend and Alteryx to support data modeling and profiling activities. Build and schedule jobs in Oracle data warehouse.
Technical Writing - Document enterprise-level policies and procedures for DFARs/NIST 800-171 compliance. Maintain team intranet site.

work.position: Global Tools Administrator, Global Business Management Services
highlights: Business Intelligence - Build views in data warehouse. Build ad-hoc queries in Oracle PL/SQL. Perform analyses in Excel, R, and Tibco Spotfire.

Application Support, Informatica - Maintain connections to and mappings between data sources including Oracle and Salesforce, and schedules for data replication tasks. Monitor IP ranges of cloud-based data sources for firewall rules. Develop Bash and batch scripts to support troubleshooting of network issues.

Application Support, Tibco Spotfire - Install, maintain, and upgrade visual analytics tool. Build and maintain connections to data sources. Train and support 200 users on analytic and data visualization techniques. Maintain Active Directory user lists. Develop Powershell scripts to track user licensing.

Pricing Administration - Serve as SME on topic of Pricing. Build and maintain price lists, price breaks, discount/surcharge modifiers, and supporting data sets within Oracle. Work with Product Management, Client Management, and Finance to support annual price increase process.

work.position: Oracle Customer Support Analyst (Contractor), Aviation Applications Administration
highlights: Business Analysis - Facilitates creation of product launches and system enhancements by gathering requirements, reviewing with Change Control Board, planning and executing system testing, coordinating user acceptance testing, documenting system and process changes, performing train-the-trainer activities, and coordinating similar activities with Eastern Hemisphere colleagues.

Application Support, Oracle - Tier 1 support. Served as the go-between for business units, ITS, Finance, Distribution, and Product Management, in order to report on and troubleshoot issues with Oracle R12 applications, including Trading Community Architecture, Order Management, Subscription Maintenance, Pricing, Install Base, and Configurator Developer modules.
Performed Exploratory Web Testing for clients through uTest.com
Performed Black-Box Testing of Android apps.

work.position: Sr. Transactions Analyst, Corporate Printing Division
highlights: Identified system limitations in Production database, made recommendations to trainers and management regarding policies and procedures designed to work around critical issues, improve accuracy and efficiency of order management process.
Utilized Oracle Order Management 11i to resolve billing disputes and ensure customer satisfaction.
Assisted business support analyst with end-user testing of new upgrades on separate QA databases as well as stress testing of Production database during ERP conversion project to Oracle.

Worked closely with sales, billing, order management, and collection departments located across the country, to maintain customer satisfaction for large customer accounts, including all Federal Government accounts, specifically with billing and invoicing errors.

courses: Data Warehouse Concepts, Design, and Data Integration
Relational Database Support for Data Warehouses
Business Intelligence Concepts, Tools, and Applications

history.organization: INFORMS (The Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences)
International Institute of Business Analysis™ (IIBA®): Denver Chapter

awards.title: Awesomeness Award
awards.summary: Thanks for being a HackMyResume / FluentCV user!

awards.title: MVP: SpinWidget Technology
awards.summary: For work in promotion and popularization of SpinWidget technology.

references.name: Kathy Doherty (Applications and Process Manager at Jeppesen)
references.reference: Aaron came in as a contractor five years ago and has continued to prove and enhance his worth to the company with critical initiatives such as annual price increases, and taking over sole administration duties for Spotfire and Informatica. He spearheaded the initiative to get our global team moving onto Agile methodology for the multitude of work requests coming in. Aaron has been the resource many departments come to for issues with data, with integration of systems, with ideas that need exploring. He has been intimately involved on many of our customer data integration efforts over the years and demonstrated his expertise of analyzing, developing and maintaining the mapping or troubleshooting of customer information and the flows between Oracle, Salesforce, Informatica and Icertis. It is my sincere hope that whichever organization Aaron ends up in will appreciate his dedication and incredible work ethic. He has shown a consistency and performance that far outstrips his current job level. He has been the critical linchpin in many efforts going on in this company, and a true stabilizing force on a team that has a very difficult load to handle, and ideally that will be rewarded sometime in the future.

references.name: Rosemary Ramirez-Hernandez (Sr. Manager Customer Service at Boeing Global Services)
references.reference: Very knowledgeable in Oracle and other systems.

references.name: Mary C Stolp (BPC Business Processor at OCE)
references.reference: Aaron is very customer service driven and is very knowledgeable in oracle.
